trans-unit.source: Asset manager
trans-unit.target: Asset manager

trans-unit.source: !Warning This section is out of date. For now, you should only use it for reference.
trans-unit.target: !Warning This section is out of date. For now, you should only use it for reference.

trans-unit.source: Assets
trans-unit.target: Assets

trans-unit.source: After creating your assets in Game Studio, @'Stride.Core.Serialization.Assets.AssetManager' is the class responsible for loading, unloading and saving assets.
trans-unit.target: After creating your assets in Game Studio, @'Stride.Core.Serialization.Assets.AssetManager' is the class responsible for loading, unloading and saving assets.

trans-unit.source: Creating
trans-unit.target: Creating

trans-unit.source: You usually create assets directly in Game Studio.
trans-unit.target: You usually create assets directly in Game Studio.

trans-unit.source: Their URL will match the name (including folder) in Game Studio.
trans-unit.target: Their URL will match the name (including folder) in Game Studio.

trans-unit.source: Examples of URLs:
trans-unit.target: Examples of URLs:

trans-unit.source: knight (user imports knight.fbx directly in main asset folder)
trans-unit.target: knight (user imports knight.fbx directly in main asset folder)

trans-unit.source: level1/room1 (user creates level1 and import room1.fbx inside)
trans-unit.target: level1/room1 (user creates level1 and import room1.fbx inside)

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Assets for more details.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Assets for more details.

trans-unit.source: Loading
trans-unit.target: Loading

trans-unit.source: Loading an asset should be done with the help of @'Stride.Core.Serialization.Assets.AssetManager' class:
trans-unit.target: Loading an asset should be done with the help of @'Stride.Core.Serialization.Assets.AssetManager' class:

trans-unit.source: Note that loading an asset that has already been loaded only increment the reference counter and do not reload the asset.
trans-unit.target: Note that loading an asset that has already been loaded only increment the reference counter and do not reload the asset.

trans-unit.source: Unloading
trans-unit.target: Unloading

trans-unit.source: Unloading is also done using the AssetManager class:
trans-unit.target: Unloading is also done using the AssetManager class:

trans-unit.source: Asset.Unload(asset);
trans-unit.target: Asset.Unload(asset);

trans-unit.source: Asset life time
trans-unit.target: Asset life time

trans-unit.source: Asset load and unload are working in pairs. For each call to 'load', a corresponding call to 'unload' is expected.
trans-unit.target: Asset load and unload are working in pairs. For each call to 'load', a corresponding call to 'unload' is expected.

trans-unit.source: An asset is actually loaded only during the first call to 'load'. All subsequent calls only result to an asset reference increment.
trans-unit.target: An asset is actually loaded only during the first call to 'load'. All subsequent calls only result to an asset reference increment.

trans-unit.source: An asset is actually unload only when the number of call to unload match the number of call the load.
trans-unit.target: An asset is actually unload only when the number of call to unload match the number of call the load.

trans-unit.source: The @'Stride.Core.Serialization.Assets.AssetManager.Get' method returns the reference to a loaded asset but does not increment the asset reference counter.
trans-unit.target: The @'Stride.Core.Serialization.Assets.AssetManager.Get' method returns the reference to a loaded asset but does not increment the asset reference counter.
